data.name: AssignmentBoxing_Description
data.value: This collection has a value type enumerator. Assigning it to an interface cause it to be boxed and method calls to be virtual, affecting performance.

data.name: AssignmentBoxing_MessageFormat
data.value: '{0}' has a value type enumerator. Assigning it to '{1}' causes boxing of the enumerator.

data.name: AssignmentBoxing_Title
data.value: Assigment to interface causes boxing of enumerator

data.name: AvoidSingle_Description
data.value: Single() and SingleOrDefault() may perform much more iterations to perform unnecessary validation. Use First() or FirstOrDefault() instead.

data.name: AvoidSingle_MessageFormat
data.value: Avoid the use of '{0}'. Use '{1}' instead.

data.name: AvoidSingle_Title
data.value: Avoid Single() and SingleOrDefault()

data.name: GetEnumeratorReturnType_Description
data.value: Returning a value-type enumerator allows 'foreach' loops to perform better. It will allocate the enumerator on the heap and calls to enumerator methods are not virtual.

data.name: GetEnumeratorReturnType_MessageFormat
data.value: '{0}' returns a reference type. Consider returning a value type.

data.name: GetEnumeratorReturnType_Title
data.value: GetEnumerator() or GetAsyncEnumerator() should return a value type.

data.name: HighestLevelInterface_Description
data.value: Public methods should return highest admissible level interface.

data.name: HighestLevelInterface_MessageFormat
data.value: Consider returning '{0}' instead.

data.name: HighestLevelInterface_Title
data.value: Public methods should return highest admissible level interface.

data.name: NonDisposableEnumerator_Description
data.value: The enumerator returned has an empty Dispose(). Consider returning a non-disposable enumerator.

data.name: NonDisposableEnumerator_MessageFormat
data.value: '{0}' has an empty Dispose(). Consider returning a non-disposable enumerator.

data.name: NonDisposableEnumerator_Title
data.value: Consider returning a non-disposable enumerator.

data.name: NullEnumerable_Description
data.value: Enumerable can be empty but not null. 'foreach' does not check for null.

data.name: NullEnumerable_MessageFormat
data.value: Enumerable cannot be null. Return an empty enumerable instead.

data.name: NullEnumerable_Title
data.value: Enumerable cannot be null.

data.name: ReadOnlyRefEnumerable_Description
data.value: The enumerable is a value type but is not defined as read only.

data.name: ReadOnlyRefEnumerable_MessageFormat
data.value: '{0}' is a value type. Consider making it 'readonly'.

data.name: ReadOnlyRefEnumerable_Title
data.value: The enumerable should be readonly value type.

data.name: RefEnumerationVariable_Description
data.value: The enumerator returns a reference to the item. The type should be declared acordingly so that no copies are performed.

data.name: RefEnumerationVariable_MessageFormat
data.value: The enumerator returns a reference to the item. Add '{0}' to the item type.

data.name: RefEnumerationVariable_Title
data.value: The enumerator returns a reference to the item.
